ai.summary: A strenuous 21.5 km ridge hike in the UK, from Newton Bridge to Amulree. Expect exposed ridgelines, variable weather, and remote terrain requiring good fitness, navigation, and preparation.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged ridge terrain with exposed sections, rocky ascents, boggy moorland, and occasional woodland near endpoints. Navigation can be tricky in bad visibility; be prepared for sudden weather changes and long stretches without shelter.
ai.safety_notes: Plan as a long day or multi-day trek with a clear route and timing. Always inform someone of your plan and expected return. Check the forecast; UK ridge weather can change rapidly with wind, rain, and cold. Carry a detailed map and compass (GPS as backup). Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers; bring waterproof jacket and trousers. Stay hydrated and carry extra food. Be prepared for boggy ground and exposed sections; use trekking poles for stability. Respect difficult sections; if conditions worsen, turn back. Carry a whistle, first-aid kit, emergency blanket, and a personal locator beacon if available.
recommended_gear: Sturdy, waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Gloves and hat for cold or windy conditions
Hydration system or ample water supply
Personal locator beacon or satellite messenger (where available)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly May–September) offer the best chances for dry, daylight conditions in the UK; however, weather can be unpredictable year-round, so be prepared.
